title: Dysthymia
summary: Dysthymia, also known as persistent depressive disorder (PDD),[3] is a mental and behavioral disorder,[5] specifically a disorder primarily of mood, consisting of the same cognitive and physical problems as depression, but with longer-lasting symptoms.[3][6][7] The concept was coined by Robert Spitzer as a replacement for the term "depressive personality" in the late 1970s.[8]
